Description: Gold earring with stone setting; plain wire ring to which is soldered a pear-shaped setting containing a garnet; the wire passes through a small ring soldered to the back of the setting, to which are attached two small corrugated loops for pendants.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2595)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.119, Tomb 79)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No.101, p.30)
